us.conxio.HL7.HL7Stream
Interface HL7Stream

All Known Implementing Classes:
HL7FileReader, HL7FileWriter, HL7Server, HL7SocketStream, HL7StreamBase
public interface HL7Stream

An abstract class to serve as a base for HL7 message stream classes.

          Appender type

Method Summary
 boolean close()
          Closes the context stream.
 java.lang.String description()
          Creates a description of the current state of the context stream.

Method Detail

open

boolean open()
             throws HL7IOException
Opens the context stream.

Returns:
true if the operation succeeded, otherwise false.
Throws:
HL7IOException

close

boolean close()
              throws HL7IOException
Closes the context stream.

Returns:
true if the operation succeeded, otherwise false.
Throws:
HL7IOException

read

HL7Message read()
                throws HL7IOException
Reads a HL7 message from the context stream.

Returns:
the message read as a HL7Message object.
Throws:
HL7IOException

write

boolean write(HL7Message msg)
              throws HL7IOException
Write a HL7 message to the context stream.

Parameters:
msg - the message to send as a HL7Message object.
Returns:
true if the operation succeeded, otherwise false.
Throws:
HL7IOException

status

int status()
Access to the current status of the context stream.

Returns:
the current status value of the context stream.

isClosed

boolean isClosed()
Determines whether the context stream is closed.

Returns:
true if the context stream is closed, otherwise false.

isOpen

boolean isOpen()
Determines whether the context stream is open.

Returns:
true if the context stream is open, otherwise false.

isServer

boolean isServer()
Determines whether the context stream is a server.

Returns:
true if the context stream is a server, otherwise false.

description

java.lang.String description()
Creates a description of the current state of the context stream.

Returns:
the description as a string.

dispatchHandler

HL7MessageHandler dispatchHandler()
Extracts the HL7MessageHandler from the context stream, if it is valid.

Returns:
the HL7MessageHandler, or null if no HL7MessageHandler is available.
